title: Chet Faker Expands â€˜A Love for Strangersâ€™ Tour With New AustraliaÂ Dates
summary: The tour supports A Love for Strangers, Chet Fakerâ€™s forthcoming album due Feb. 13 via BMG.
body: Chet Faker has announced two new Australian headline shows as part of his ongoing A Love for Strangers world tour. The additional concerts are set for March 3 at Brisbaneâ€™s Fortitude Music Hall and March 4 at Sydneyâ€™s Enmore Theatre. The newly announced dates arrive amid an already busy touring schedule for the Australian singer-songwriter, who is also set to perform at Adelaideâ€™s A Day in the Gully festival on Feb. 28, followed by shows in Melbourne on March 1 and Perth on March 6. The tour supports A Love for Strangers , Chet Fakerâ€™s forthcoming album due Feb. 13 via BMG. The project marks his first full-length release since 2021â€™s Hotel Surrender and arrives more than a decade after his breakout debut, Built on Glass , which was released in 2014. That album helped establish Faker â€” born Nick Murphy â€” as one of Australiaâ€™s most globally recognized electronic and alternative artists, powered by songs including â€œTalk Is Cheapâ€ and â€œGold.â€ New material from A Love for Strangers has already begun to surface, with recent singles â€œFar Side of the Moonâ€ and â€œThis Time for Realâ€ offering an early glimpse into the recordâ€™s direction. The album is positioned as a reflective moment in Murpâ€¦

title: Your Galaxy phone is about to get very strange
summary: The unexpected surprise is pulled directly from another dimension.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung has released free Stranger Things themes and wallpapers for Galaxy phones. You can download them from the Galaxy Store if you have the Netflix app installed. The pack is only available from January 12 to February 22, so donâ€™t wait too long. Stranger Things may be over for good, but thatâ€™s not stopping Samsung from leaning hard into hype. To celebrate the final season of the mega-hit series, the company is now rolling out special Stranger Things theme packs and wallpapers for Galaxy phones. These new theme packs will be available for a limited time and will allow fans of the Netflix show to turn their homescreens into a scene from Hawkins or the Upside Down.

title: â€˜KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ & â€˜Sinnersâ€™ Win in Music Categories at 2026 GoldenÂ Globes
summary: "Golden" & the Sinners score won in the same categories a week ago at the Critics Choice Awards.
body: â€œGoldenâ€ from KPop Demon Hunters won best original song at the 2026 Golden Globes , which were presented Sunday (Jan. 11) at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, California. The fizzy smash is the first song from an animated film to win at the Globes since Prince â€™s â€œThe Song of the Heartâ€ from Happy Feet , which won in 2007. HUNTR/X’s recording of â€œGoldenâ€ logged eight weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100. Only one other song that topped the Hot 100 for eight or more weeks went on to win the Globe: â€œYou Light Up My Lifeâ€ from the 1977 film of the same name. The Joseph Brooks song was a 10-week Hot 100 leader for Debby Boone . Related â€˜Goldenâ€™ and â€˜Sinnersâ€™ Score Win in Music Categories at 2026 Critics Choice Awards: Full Winners List â€˜Goldenâ€™ and Songs from â€˜Sinnersâ€™ and â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ on Oscar Shortlist for Best Original Song â€˜Sinners,â€™ â€˜Frankenstein,â€™ â€˜F1â€™ and More on Oscar Shortlist for Best Original Score: Full List The Globes credited â€œGoldenâ€ to composers Joong Gyu Kwak, Yu Han Lee, Hee Dong Nam, Jeong Hoon Seo and Park Hong Jun and lyricists Kim Eun-Jae ( EJAE ) and Mark Sonnenblick. EJAE also popularized the song as a member of HUNTR/X (aâ€¦

title: Got a random Instagram password reset email? Hereâ€™s what actually happened
summary: Instagram says there was no hack, but confirms something fishy took place.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A wave of password reset emails went out to Instagram users around the world over the weekend. Instagram claims there was no data breach, but rather an abuse of its reset system. Even Android Authority got multiple reset emails for our official account. Over the weekend, Instagram users around the world were spooked after receiving unexpected emails asking them to reset their passwords. Given the nature of the email, many worried their accounts had been hacked.

title: Snoop Dogg Presents Amy Poehler With Inaugural Best Podcast Award at 2026 Golden Globes: â€˜This Is Exactly How I PicturedÂ Itâ€™
summary: Snoop even rechristened the Golden Globes "the Double G's."
body: Snoop Dogg brought his legendary swagger to the 2026 Golden Globes stage on Sunday night (Jan. 11), hitting the stage to present the first-ever best podcast award. And in the process, he even gave the 82-year-old awards show a new nickname. “Need yâ€™all to loosen up a little bit. This is the Double G’s — the Double G’s is the Golden Globes,” Snoop said after walking out to his 2004 three-week Billboard Hot 100 No. 1 hit “Drop It Like It’s Hot.” “And youâ€™re with the D-O-Double-G, so make sure you enjoy yourself. Don’t be no stiff biff. Need you to move around a little bit.” Related Here Are the 2026 Golden Globes Winners: Full List (Updating Live) 2026 Golden Globes: Best Photos From The Red Carpet â€˜Itâ€™s Never Too Late to Shineâ€™: EJAE Gives Inspiring Golden Globes Speech After K-Pop Smash Wins Best Original Song It seems that Snoop’s nickname made an impression: When One Battle After Another director Paul Thomas Anderson accepted the best screenplay award later in the night, he said, â€œI got a Double G. Amazing.” Getting back to the award at hand, Snoop shouted out the Globes for adding a besâ€¦

title: â€˜Itâ€™s Never Too Late to Shineâ€™: EJAE Gives Inspiring Golden Globes Speech After K-Pop Smash Wins Best OriginalÂ Song
summary: The singer-songwriter opened up about rejection and "redirection" in a candid speech.
body: KPop Demon Hunters isnâ€™t done changing culture just yet. On Sunday (Jan. 11) night at the 2026 Golden Globes, the filmâ€™s signature smash â€œGoldenâ€ became the first K-pop song to win the Golden Globes for best original song, motion picture. Performed by HUNTR/X (EJAE, Audrey Nuna & REI AMI) with music by Joong Gyu Kwak, Yu Han Lee, Hee Dong Nam, Jeong Hoon Seo and Park Hong Jun and lyrics by Kim Eun-Jae (EJAE) and Mark Sonnenblick, â€œGoldenâ€ won the Golden Globe for its aforementioned songwriters. In her teary acceptance speech, EJAE (Kim Eun-Jae) opened up about rejection, â€œredirectionâ€ and finding her purpose. EJAE said she worked â€œtirelessly for 10 yearsâ€ as a young girl to become a K-pop idol, but was â€œrejected and disappointedâ€ when she was eventually told her â€œvoice wasnâ€™t good enough.â€ â€œSo I leaned on song and music to get through it and now Iâ€™m here as a singer-songwriter,â€ she continued. â€œItâ€™s a dream come true to be part of a song thatâ€™s helping other girls, other boys and everyone of all ages to get through their hardships and accept themselves.â€ EJAE added, â€œThis award goes to people who had doors closed on them. I can confidently say rejection is redirection. Itâ€™s neâ€¦

title: Ariana Grandeâ€™s Signature Ponytail Returns at 2026 GoldenÂ Globes
summary: The dark, high pony had long been Grande's go-to hairstyle pre-Glinda.
body: Goodbye, Glinda. Ariana Grande shifted back to her signature style at the 2026 Golden Globes, opting for a custom-designed, black Vivienne Westwood dress and a brunette, high ponytail in place of the pale pink gowns and blonde locks she’d adopted during her Wicked era. Related 2026 Golden Globes: Best Photos From The Red Carpet Here Are the 2026 Golden Globes Winners: Full List (Updating Live) Ariana Grande Teases Upcoming Project She’s ‘Very Excited’ About, But Can’t Reveal Yet: ‘It Contains Multitudes’ The high ponytail has long been Grande’s signature hairstyle. The choice to return to it seems fitting as she gets closer to kicking off her highly anticipated Eternal Sunshine Tour, which launches in June. Ariana Grande attends the 83rd Annual Golden Globe Awards at the Beverly Hilton on Jan. 11, 2026 in Beverly Hills, Calif. Amy Sussman/Getty Images Grande was nominated for best performance by a female actor in a supporting role in any motion picture for her role as Glinda in Jon M. Chu’s Wicked: For Good at Sunday night’s ceremony. (Catch up with the full list of Golden Globe nominees and winners as theyâ€¦

title: Teyana Taylor Gives Teary Speech After Surprise Golden Globe Win: â€˜I Almost Didnâ€™t Write a Speech Because I Didnâ€™t Think Iâ€™dÂ Winâ€™
summary: The actor-musician won for her celebrated role in One Battle After Another.
body: Paul Thomas Andersonâ€™s One Battle After Another went into the 2026 Golden Globes as a favorite: it received nine nods, the most of any film nominated this year. But Teyana Taylor â€™s win was far from a foregone conclusion. When it was revealed that the actor-musical artist had won her first Golden Globe — best performance by a female actor in a supporting role in any motion picture — on Sunday (Jan. 11) night, she was beside herself. â€œI almost didnâ€™t write a speech because I didnâ€™t think Iâ€™d win,â€ Taylor said, crying and even shaking a bit as she began her acceptance remarks. â€œMy babies are upstairs watching â€“ yâ€™all better be off those damn phones and watching right now,â€ she joked. As her co-stars (and many others) gave her a standing ovation, Taylor thanked her director, calling him â€œPaul â€˜Let Him Cookâ€™ Andersonâ€ and thanking him for his â€œvisionâ€ of One Battle After Another, which he also co-wrote. After thanking her family, co-stars and team, she added an impactful message. â€œLast, but most importantly, to my Brown sisters and little Brown girls watching tonight. Our softness is not a liability. Our depth is not too much. Our light does not need permission to shine. Wâ€¦

title: 2026 Golden Globes: Best Photos From The RedÂ Carpet
summary: Check out pics from the 83rd annual Golden Globes' red carpet.
body: For the second year in a row, Nikki Glaser is readying some zingers, grabbing the mic and hosting the Golden Globes on Sunday (Jan. 11). Plenty of music stars are present and accounted for at the show and on the Golden Globes red carpet: Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco, Nick Jonas and Priyanka Chopra, Teyana Taylor, Jennifer Lopez, Omar Apollo, Snoop Dogg and many others. One Battle After Another, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Teyana Taylor, Sean Penn and Chase Infiniti, leads the nominations among movies with nine nods. Wicked: For Good , starring Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo, nabbed five nominations. On the television side, The White Lotus has the most nominations (six) with the Selena Gomez-starring Only Murders in the Building nabbing four nods. Lopez gave Entertainment Tonight â€™s red carpet hosts a preview of what to expect from her next film, Office Romance . â€œItâ€™s a romantic comedy, itâ€™s a little edgy. Itâ€™s not your typical J.Lo romcom,â€ she said. â€œIt is a romcom, but itâ€™s also a new evolution of it.â€ Miley Cyrus told ET â€™s red carpet host about writing â€œDream As Oneâ€ for Avatar: Fire and Ash alongside her co-writers, Mark Ronson and Andrew Wyatt. â€œWeâ€™re starting from a placâ€¦

title: Susan Schuh: Supporting the Humans in Human Spaceflight
summary: Susan Schuh has dedicated her career to helping humans adapt to life beyond Earth. As the Flight Crew Integration Operational Habitability (OpsHab) team lead in NASAâ€™s Human Health and Performance Directorate at Johnson Space Center in Houston, Schuh leads efforts to understand what it is really liâ€¦
body: Susan Schuh has dedicated her career to helping humans adapt to life beyond Earth.   As the Flight Crew Integration Operational Habitability (OpsHab) team lead in NASAâ€™s Human Health and Performance Directorate at Johnson Space Center in Houston, Schuh leads efforts to understand what it is really like to live and work in space. She turns that information into progress by documenting astronautsâ€™ feedback to improve current and future spaceflight missions.  Official portrait of Susan Schuh. NASA/Josh Valcarcel Her work not only supports crews aboard the International Space Station, but also provides critical information for NASA’s preparations to explore more of the lunar surface than ever before through Artemis missions.   Her team supports astronaut inflight and postflight debriefs, capturing and analyzing feedback to help NASA apply lessons learned. They also manage one of NASAâ€™s most valuable habitability tools, the Crew Comments Database. With more than 115,000 entries spanning 25 years of International Space Station missions, it is the only comprehensive and searchable record of crew feedback in existence. Every comment, from how astronauts sleep to â€¦

title: Here Are the 2026 Golden Globes Winners: Full List (UpdatingÂ Live)
summary: Follow along with Billboard all night for the full list of winners -- including who took home best original song & best original score.
body: The 2026 Golden Globe Awards have arrived! Billboard is on the red carpet at The Beverly Hilton, and we’re also updating the full list of Golden Globe winners all Sunday night (Jan. 11) below. Related 2026 Golden Globes: Best Photos From The Red Carpet Of course, Billboard paid special attention to the two music categories: best original song and best original score. There was a lot of star power in the song category, but in the end, the eight-week Billboard Hot 100 No. 1 hit “Golden” — performed by HUNTR/X (EJAE, Audrey Nuna and REI AMI) for the Netflix animated powerhouse KPop Demon Hunters — came out on top . The massive hit had competition from Miley Cyrus’ “Dream as One” from Avatar: Fire & Ash , which was written by Cyrus, Andrew Wyatt, Mark Ronson and Simon Franglen; Miles Caton’s “I Lied to You,” written by Raphael Saadiq and Ludwig GÃ¶ransson for Sinners ; Cynthia Erivo’s “No Place Like Home” written by Stephen Schwartz for Wicked: For Good ; Ariana Grande’s “The Girl in the Bubble,” also written by Schwartz for the Wicked sequel; and Nick Cave’s title trackâ€¦

title: Goals, shocks and fan power on a record-breaking FA Cup weekend
summary: If anyone needed convincing that the FA Cup still matters, this season's record-breaking third round provided all the necessary evidence.

title: Castellanos scores in extra time as West Ham edge past QPR
summary: Valentin 'Taty' Castellanos scores his first goal for West Ham United as they beat Queens Park Rangers in extra time and progress to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

title: Sargent made himself unavailable for Norwich cup win - Clement
summary: Philippe Clement says Josh Sargent will not be leaving Norwich in January, after claiming the striker made himself unavailable for Sunday's FA Cup tie with Walsall.

title: Magic Makama hat-trick as Norwich beat Walsall
summary: Twenty-one-year-old Jovon Makama scores a hat-trick as Norwich City beat Walsall in the FA Cup third round.

title: Two for Reed as Mansfield upset Sheff Utd in thriller
summary: Mansfield Town cause one of the shocks of the FA Cup third round with a stunning victory over Sheffield United in a seven-goal thriller at Bramall Lane.

title: Own goal gives Spurs narrow home win over Leicester
summary: Signe Gaupset impresses on her Women's Super League debut as Tottenham defeat Leicester City to boost their push for a Champions League place.

title: Chelsea kick off new year by thrashing West Ham
summary: Chelsea begin the new year with an impressive victory over West Ham in visiting manager Rita Guarino's first match in the Women's Super League.

title: Arsenal beat Portsmouth thanks to Martinelli hat-trick
summary: Gabriel Martinelli scores the first hat-trick of his senior career as an Arsenal side showing 10 changes come from a goal down to beat Championship side Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

title: Man City beat Everton at home to strengthen grip on WSL title
summary: Manchester City consolidate their place at the top of the Women's Super League table with a convincing win over Everton.

title: Substitute Gordon, 43, produces save of season to keep Hearts beating
summary: Craig Gordon, 43 years young, having not played since Scotland's World Cup qualification heroics over Denmark, produces the save of the season to earn Hearts victory.

title: 'Big personality' Martinelli goes from 'idiot' to hat-trick hero
summary: Gabriel Martinelli was branded an "idiot" a few days ago - but showed great personality to respond with an FA Cup hat-trick, according to Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.

title: Maestre wants London City players to match his ambition
summary: Eder Maestre challenges London City Lionesses players to match his ambition after his managerial tenure with the Women's Super League club begins with a drab goalless draw against Liverpool.

title: Bordeaux thump Northampton in Champions Cup repeat
summary: Prem leaders Northampton are handed a European lesson by Champions Cup holders Bordeaux in a repeat of last year's final.

title: Liverpool remain bottom after goalless home draw to London City Lionesses
summary: Bottom club Liverpool remain without a win in the Women's Super League after being held to a drab goalless draw by London City Lionesses.

title: Are 'efficient' Chelsea ready to chase down titles?
summary: Having won the last six Women's Super League titles, Chelsea have not had to chase for a while. But they are up for the challenge this time.

title: Connacht let slip 17 point lead in Montpellier
summary: Montpellier score three tries in the final 15 minutes to claim a thrilling 33-31 victory over Connacht in Pool One in the Challenge Cup.

title: Leeds avoid upset with second-half comeback against Derby
summary: James Justin scored his first goal for Leeds United since joining from Leicester City in the summer, in a second-half comeback after Derby County took the lead thanks to a Ben Brereton Diaz strike.

title: Ospreys lose to Zebre but secure Europe knockout spot
summary: Ospreys qualify for the Challenge Cup knockout stages despite a 23-19 defeat to Zebre.

title: Poland beat Switzerland for debut United Cup title
summary: Poland battle back to beat Switzerland 2-1 in the United Cup final in Sydney to win the mixed-gender tournament for the first time.

title: Clovers go third in hard-fought win over Thunder
summary: Clovers climbed to third in the Celtic Challenge after a hard-fought win over Brython Thunder at the Cardiff Arms Park.

title: 'I legged it' - Macclesfield chairman joined pitch invasion
summary: Macclesfield chairman Rob Smethurst says he feels like his side "won the FA Cup" with Saturday's third-round win over holders Crystal Palace.

title: Liverpool's Bradley out for season with knee injury
summary: Liverpool defender Conor Bradley is ruled out for the rest of the domestic season after suffering a significant knee injury, involving damage to bone and ligament.

title: Owning your music is now the only defense against AI infested playlists
summary: As streaming embraces AI music, the best way to escape is a return to ownership.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Iâ€™m old enough to remember a time before Spotify heralded the golden age of music discovery. Even the early beta catalog gave me access to far more music than I could ever hope to fit on my iPod Nano, and, more importantly, made discovering new artists and exploring new genres unbelievably easy. Many of us probably owe a huge debt to streaming platforms for shaping our musical tastes and expanding our libraries. While the music streaming space has grown with both bigger libraries and a variety of new players, many of todayâ€™s top streaming platforms are quickly morphing into the very antithesis of the formula that made them such a game-changer. Unsurprisingly, itâ€™s driven by that most modern of problems: AI slop.

title: McColgan reclaims European 10km record in Valencia
summary: Briton Eilish McColgan reclaims her women's European 10km record in Valencia in a time of 30 minutes seven seconds.

title: West Ham's Tysiak set to join Union Berlin
summary: West Ham defender Amber Tysiak is closing in on a move to German side Union Berlin.

title: 'What a catch!' - Rams avoid play-off upset with 38 seconds remaining
summary: Colby Parkinson scores a touchdown with 38 seconds remaining as the Los Angeles Rams leave it late to beat the Carolina Panthers 34-31 to avoid a play-off upset.

title: Sabalenka beats Kostyuk to win third Brisbane title
summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka prepares for the Australian Open with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Marta Kostyuk to win a third Brisbane International title.

title: Hereâ€™s the one thing I want to see from Pixel 11 Pro cameras
summary: Plenty of smartphone brands have picked up this camera trick, and I hope Google follows suit.
body: Googleâ€™s Pixel 10 phones are among the best camera phones on the market, and this generation marks the first time in a while that the entire series offers a telephoto camera. The Pixel 10 ships with a 10.8MP 5x camera, while the Pixel 10 Pro phones pack a great 50MP 5x periscope camera. Thereâ€™s one big feature missing from Googleâ€™s telephoto cameras, though, and I really hope to see it on the Pixel 11 Pro line. Of course, Iâ€™m talking about telephoto macro capabilities.

title: CES 2026: Aiper brings smarter, more reliable automation to the smart yard
summary: At CES 2026, Aiper showcased the first-ever Cognitive AI Powered pool cleaner series and smart irrigation system.
body: Having a backyard pool is an incredible luxury, but the maintenance of it might make it feel more like work than pleasure. Stopping algae blooms, avoiding grime buildup, and the endless leaf and branch skimming are grueling pool maintenance tasks. A smart robot pool cleaner can make a world of difference, and thatâ€™s where Aiper comes in. Aiper is the worldâ€™s no. 1 smart robotic pool cleaner brand known for its innovations in energy efficiency, sustainable design, and AI-driven automation. At CES 2026 , the company is showcasing the first-ever Cognitive AI Powered pool cleaners, the Scuba V3 series, along with its latest innovations in smart irrigation and pool water-quality management tools. With Aiper, youâ€™ll enjoy smart, reliable, and carefree smart yard maintenance, so you can spend more time in your yard rather than cleaning it. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.

title: Google Mapsâ€™ audio navigation quirks make it difficult to trust
summary: I can't keep an eye on my screen, but audio directions have left me with a bad taste.
body: While I use Google Maps even when Iâ€™m not navigating , I drove around a bit more during the holiday season and had to rely on the appâ€™s directions to get around. However, this made me acutely aware of its shortcomings when it comes to audio navigation â€” something I thought that Google wouldâ€™ve improved by now. When I drive, I mostly rely on Mapsâ€™ audio navigation. This is down to a few reasons: I donâ€™t have a smartphone mount that can reliably attach to my carâ€™s vents, I have no built-in dashboard display, and I have to stow my phone away when driving through high-crime areas.

title: 6 things you should always do before factory resetting a phone
summary: These precautions can save you from future headaches.
body: I thought that I had my phone factory reset process down to an art, thanks to the frequency with which I reset and send back review devices. But recently I had to reset an older device â€” and just before I was about to start the process, I decided to go back and check if it had missed anything important. Thatâ€™s when I realized it had a few things I actually hadnâ€™t backed up. After all, the data on a temporary or secondary device is generally less important than the data on one that you used as a daily driver. In my case, I was also selling the device, so I didnâ€™t have the option to simply leave it as-is in case I needed to recover something later.

title: I never expected an AI app to replace my keyboard, but I was wrong
summary: I've now started talking so much to my Mac.
body: I havenâ€™t typed a single word in this story â€” all of it came to life through my voice. I simply spoke to my computer what I wanted written, and the words appeared on the screen with punctuation corrected and my verbal fallacies ignored, without me lifting a finger. As a writer-journalist, I take pride in my ability to pound the keys fast enough to blur the motion without even once peeking at the keyboard. But there often comes a point when my fingers canâ€™t keep up with the pace of my rushing thoughts. And when your profession routinely demands meeting tight deadlines, speed becomes the most important factor . And somewhere along the way, typing itself became a holdback.

body: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, removed two of its historic test stands â€“ the Propulsion and Structural Test Facility and the Dynamic Test Facility â€“ with carefully coordinated implosions on Jan. 10, 2026. The demolition of these historic structures is part of a larger project at Marshall that began in spring 2022, targeting several inactive structures and building a dynamic, interconnected campus ready for the next era of space exploration. title: I (finally) ditched Google Photos for self-hosted; hereâ€™s how it went
summary: So long Google Photos, it's been great.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority I love Google Photos; its ease of use and feature set are unrivaled in my opinion. However, Iâ€™m an even bigger fan of self-hosting â€” I use my DIY NAS to replace a considerable range of overpriced subscription services. However, so far, I havenâ€™t been able to replace Google Photos completely, but I might have finally found a way to truly cut the cord. See, Iâ€™m loath to fork out for Google One when I have 10TB of hard drive space on my NAS. Still, I use Google Photos to make the occasional quick edit, to help share snaps with friends and family quickly, and even duplicate a few of my most cherished memories as part of the recommended 3-2-1 backup rule . For storing most of my older snaps, Iâ€™ve been using PhotoPrism, but as good as it is as a photo library, it lacks the rich feature set of Photos, especially for managing multiple users in my home.

title: As an Android fan, thereâ€™s only one iOS feature I want Google to copy
summary: Appleâ€™s seamless iPhone-to-iPhone migration is the gold standard that Google still hasnâ€™t matched for Android in 2026.
body: Android has long reached a point of maturity where it does a whole lot of things right for most of its user base. However, thereâ€™s always room for improvement, and one area that still frustrates me as an Android user is the process of migrating to a new phone. After using the past few generations of iPhones, Iâ€™ve noticed how excellently seamless and straightforward Appleâ€™s iPhone migration process is, and itâ€™s one of the first things I miss when I switch back to Android flagships. Google, itâ€™s 2026, and itâ€™s high time you copied Appleâ€™s simplicity in migration. Apple gets iPhone-to-iPhone transfers just right

title: I found the cutest (and strangest) Android phone at CES 2026
summary: It's two phones in one, or something like that.
body: I know that the Clicks Communicator got a lot of love at CES this year. Honestly, it probably deserves most of it â€” a physical keyboard with a fingerprint reader hidden in the spacebar is a cool design. It wasnâ€™t much of a surprise, though, as weâ€™d heard rumblings about big things out of Clicks leading up to the show. However, as I wandered the show floor on my last day in Las Vegas, I stumbled upon another tiny little Android device, and I think it might have stolen some of the Communicatorâ€™s thunder. Itâ€™s called the Ikko MindOne, and itâ€™s exactly the type of quirky little device I love to find at CES .

title: The Pixel 11 canâ€™t afford to get these 7 things wrong
summary: What Google must fix in 2026 if the Pixel 11 wants to stay relevant.
body: Pixels have always put the â€œsmartâ€ in the word smartphone. Theyâ€™ve stood for the best of the smart features and AI capabilities the smartphone world has ever seen, and have often led from the front. Compared to the AI features Pixels have been offering for years, like Magic Eraser, Apple Intelligence barely holds ground. I was mighty impressed by the Pixel 10 that launched last year, and I genuinely think itâ€™s a better phone than even the Pro model. Yet, I still feel the Pixel 10 series just wasnâ€™t enough. Thereâ€™s only so much Google can do to improve the Pixel 10 series through software updates â€” and to be fair, it does quite a lot. But as we enter 2026, my hopes are firmly placed on the Pixel 11. We still have a few months before the next Pixel launches, but I want to use this time to share my wishlist with Google.

title: New year, new me: 5 popular apps Iâ€™m replacing in 2026, and why
summary: The time has come.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority I always see the start of every year as a blank piece of paper â€” a chance to start fresh. And thatâ€™s exactly what Iâ€™ll be doing this year when it comes to the apps and services I use. I regularly use several of them, but itâ€™s time to make changes for two reasons. The first is that some of these apps simply donâ€™t serve me anymore, whether due to a lack of functionality or a price point thatâ€™s become too high. The second is that switching to a new app Iâ€™ll use regularly is actually a fun process for me. It gives me that boost of energy I need to kick off the year on the right note.

title: The tipping point: Hereâ€™s when buying a NAS make financial sense
summary: If youâ€™re paying for high tier cloud storage, the math may already favor owning a NAS.
body: With everything moving to a subscription model and increasing cloud dependence, we are living in the era of the forever tax. Between Spotify, Netflix, and cloud storage, we pay for music, movies, and to keep our own digital memories safe. And while cloud storage started as a convenient utility with fairly minimal charges for an additional 100GB of storage when photos were all we uploaded, thatâ€™s not the case anymore. Between years of data archives, larger photo files, and even larger 4K video-first content capture being the norm, for many of us, it has morphed into a significant monthly bill that we arenâ€™t really in a position to cancel. Over here at Android Authority , weâ€™ve talked about Network Attached Storage, or NAS , as a solution for the privacy-conscious or the tech-savvy enthusiasts who want to de-Google their lives and reduce their cloud dependence. Weâ€™ve even talked about data sovereignty and actually owning your files in a world that desperately wants you to rent them. But while all that is great, cost is another significant factor to consider. The fact of the matter is that a significant chunk of users considering a local storage option are only trying to reduce theirâ€¦

title: Final Steps Underway for NASAâ€™s First Crewed Artemis Moon Mission
summary: As NASA moves closer to launch of the Artemis II test flight, the agency soon will roll its SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft to the launch pad for the first time at the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to begin final integration, testing, and launch rehearsals. NASA is â€¦
body: NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket is seen inside High Bay 3 of the Vehicle Assembly Building as teams await the arrival of Artemis II crewmembers to board their Orion spacecraft on top of the rocket as part of the Artemis II countdown demonstration test, Saturday, Dec. 20, 2025, at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. NASA/Joel Kowsky As NASA moves closer to launch of the Artemis II test flight, the agency soon will roll its SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft to the launch pad for the first time at the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to begin final integration, testing, and launch rehearsals. NASA is targeting no earlier than Saturday, Jan. 17, to begin the multi-hour trek from the Vehicle Assembly Building to Launch Pad 39B. The four-mile journey on the crawler-transporter-2 will take up to 12 hours. Teams are working around the clock to close out all tasks ahead of rollout. However, this target date is subject to change if additional time is needed for technical preparations or weather. â€œ We are moving closer to Artemis II, with rollout just around the corner,â€ said Lori Glaze, acting associate administrator for NASAâ€™s Exploration Systems Devâ€¦

title: Shaken, Not Stirred: NASAâ€™s StarBurst Aces Extreme Temperature Tests
summary: Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled â€“ NASAâ€™s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Centerâ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s StarBurst instrument outside a thermal vacuum chamber at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. NASA/Daniel Kocevski Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled â€“ NASA’s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. StarBurst is designed to detect the initial emission of short gamma-ray bursts, some of the most powerful explosions in the universe and a key indicator of neutron star mergers. This would provide valuable insight into such events, which are also detected through gravitational waves by observatories on Earth. These events are where most of the heavy metals in the universe, such as gold and platinum, are formed. To date, only one such event has been observed simultaneously in gravitational waves and gamma-rays; StarBurst is expected to find up to 10 per year. StarBurst arrived at NASA Marshall in March 2025. During its time at the center, the instrument underwent thermal testing in a vacuum chamber and flight vibratâ€¦

An update to Android Auto is expected to roll out soon, but itâ€™s not obvious that update will solve this problem. Android Auto seems to be acting up for some users. 9to5Google spotted today that multiple users have reported theyâ€™re unable to reply to messages from their in-car displays, but the issue seems to be contained to a relatively small group of users. Apparently a recent bug is causing in-car Android Auto displays to throw up an error message when some users attempt to reply to messages, telling them that they need to ask their Google Workspace administrator for permission.

title: T-Mobile takes the crown for best overall experience in latest Opensignal tests
summary: The 'Un-carrier' continues to dominate Opensignal's rankings.
body: TL;DR T-Mobile took the top spot in Opensignalâ€™s latest carrier rankings. The carrier beat out Verizon and AT&T in 12 of 16 categories. Download speed was T-Mobileâ€™s biggest win: Opensignal rates it as more than twice as fast as the competition. Analytics firm Opensignal releases crowdsourced reports based on data collected by mobile customers, using data points from all over to evaluate mobile carriers in more than a dozen different categories. In Opensignalâ€™s latest report comparing the big three carriers, T-Mobile cleaned up, nabbing the top spot in the majority of segments. In its latest Mobile Network Experience Report, Opensignal reports that T-Mobile is the carrier to beat in most aspects, including in critical areas like upload speed, download speed, and 5G availability (though Verizon did win out when it comes to overall coverage). In all, T-Mobile was ranked highest in 12 of 16 categories.

A new leak reveals that a Privacy Display card does appear in the Tips app for the Galaxy S26 Plus. The card appears to include the same animations and descriptive text as the one found on the spoofed S26 Ultra. When youâ€™re out in public, the last thing you want is for nosy strangers to be looking at what youâ€™re doing on your phone. There have since been plenty of leaks suggesting that this will be a Galaxy S26 Ultra feature. But what about the other models in the series? A new leak may have revealed the answer to that question. title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Plus battery capacity gets outed, and itâ€™s not great news

The rated battery capacity for the upcoming midsize flagship matches that of its predecessor, and Samsung is still using a lithium-ion battery. The wired charging speed is unchanged, too, with the Galaxy S26 Plus certified to support 45W over a cable. A new year means new Samsung Galaxy phones arenâ€™t far away, and the upcoming Galaxy S26 series is rumored to launch as soon as next month. As we get closer to the expected launch window for the Samsung Galaxy S26 models, regulatory and third-party certifications clarify specifications about the devices ahead of their official unveiling. Now, the Samsung Galaxy S26 Plus has been spotted by The Tech Outlook on the TUV database. The certification reveals the exact battery capacity and charging speed for the upcoming midsize Galaxy phone. The unnamed Samsung phone spotted on the TUV certification database is identified with the model number SM-S947B/DS, which previous leaks revealed is the model number of the Galaxy S26 Plus . The certification lists Samsung using a lithium-ion battery for the Galaxy S26 Plus with a râ€¦

title: Flight Engineers Give NASAâ€™s Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s mostâ€¦
body: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s most advanced space simulation and testing laboratories. From left, Johns Hopkins APL engineers Tyler Radomsky and Felipe Ruiz install a rotor on the Dragonfly test model at the Transonic Dynamics Tunnel at NASAâ€™s Langley Research Center in Virginia. NASA Set for launch in in 2028, the Dragonfly rotorcraft is being designed and built at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) in Laurel, Maryland, with contributions from organizations around the world. On arrival in 2034, Dragonfly will exploit Titan’s dense atmosphere and low gravity to fly to dozens of locations, exploring varied environments from organic equatorial dunes to an impact crater where liquid water and complex organic materials essential to life (at least as we know it) may have existed together. Aerodynamic testing When full rotorcraft integration and testing begins in February, the team will tap into a trove oâ€¦

title: Nothing is finally ditching Lock Glimpse, but one model has to wait
summary: The Phone 3a Lite still has Lock Glimpse.
body: TL;DR The December Nothing OS update removes Lock Glimpse from Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Pro. Nothing Phone 3a Lite still has Lock Glimpse installed, but it can be disabled. Nothing says a future update will let Phone 3a Lite users uninstall Lock Glimpse. Nothing phones started getting Android 16 with the rollout of Nothing OS 4.0 in November . On Nothing Phone 3a, 3a Pro , and 3a Lite, the update included a feature called Lock Glimpse, a widely panned addition that served ads on those phonesâ€™ lock screens. Now, Nothing has announced that itâ€™s bowing to user pressure and removing the feature â€” at least on the 3a and 3a Pro. Lock Glimpse has always been an optional feature, technically â€” 3a series phones on Nothing OS 4.0 present the option to disable it. That solution wasnâ€™t satisfactory, though, as users found the software was draining their batteries even when turned off . Today, Nothing shared that the feature is being removed from the 3a series (except the 3a Lite) as of the Nothing OS 4.0 December update.

title: Honorâ€™s slim Magic 8 Pro variant officially has a launch date, and itâ€™s soon
summary: Honor's upcoming thin smartphone looks like an iPhone Air clone.
body: TL;DR Honor launched the Magic 8 Pro and Lite in the UK, but another Magic 8 series phone is launching soon. The company confirmed the Honor Magic 8 Pro Air, a slimmer Magic 8 Pro variant, will be unveiled on January 19. Honor is taking pre-reservations for the Magic 8 Pro Air in 256GB, 512GB, and 1TB configurations in China. Honor officially launched the Honor Magic 8 Pro and Magic 8 Lite in the UK this week, with the former being a true flagship and the latter striking a more affordable price point. The Honor Magic 8 Pro brings impressive specs such as a 200MP telephoto camera, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chipset , and a 6,270mAh battery capacity. However, Honor is already gearing up to launch another Magic 8 Pro variant, and it now has an official launch date. Recent teasers and rumors pointed toward Honor launching an ultra-slim version of the Magic 8 Pro, and the company confirmed in a Weibo post that this device will launch later this month as the Magic 8 Pro Air. The handset will be revealed on January 19 in China, which is less than two weeks away. The launch window opens at 8:19 a.m. EST (5:19 a.m. PST). SpaceX will livestream the event. We already have a decent idea of how this rumored feature would work, but there were a few unknowns, one of which was how the feature would handle incoming notifications from locked apps. title: Google drops the paywall on Gmailâ€™s most useful new tools
summary: Gmail's Help Me Write, AI summaries, and smart replies are coming to everyone for free.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is removing the paywall from its top-tier Gmail AI tools, previously locked behind subscriptions like Google AI Plus and Ultra. Features such as Help Me Write, Suggested Replies, and AI Overviews are now rolling out to everyone for free. If you thought the best Gmail tricks were only for paying subscribers, youâ€™re not alone. For quite some time, Gmailâ€™s most helpful new AI features have only been available to premium users. Thatâ€™s changing now. Google is removing the paywall and giving three of its most useful tools to every Gmail user for free. Before this change, getting all the AI features in Gmail meant subscribing to high-tier plans like Google AI Plus, Google AI Ultra, Google AI Pro, or other Premium tiers. Now, that barrier is gone. Regular Gmail users will soon get a big upgrade in how they manage daily emails without spending a dime.

title: Gmail now answers your email questions like Google Search â€” but youâ€™ll have to pay for it
summary: You can now ask questions in natural language, and Gmail will give you a summarized answer from your emails.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Gmail users can now use natural language questions to find specific information buried in their emails, presented to them as an AI Overview. The new Proofread feature in Gmail enables users to refine their grammar, tone, conciseness, and style using AI. Both features are powered by Gemini and are available exclusively to paid Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers in English, with a web-first rollout in the US. Most of us use Gmail practically every day, and any improvements Google can make to make emails a little easier to handle would be appreciated by billions of people worldwide (three billion, to be precise). The company announced that some of Gmailâ€™s most helpful new AI features are now being made available to all users for free . Thereâ€™s still a reason to pay for Gmail, though, as Google is now introducing new features for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Gmail will soon help you make sense of your messy inbox, Inbox-style
summary: It's like getting a lowdown from an assistant who reads your emails for you.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has announced a new AI Inbox feature that will organize important emails from your Gmail inbox into handy to-do lists. AI Inbox will prioritize emails from VIPs, such as those you email frequently or people in your Contacts. In addition to heads-up for important events, the feature will also offer summaries based on different conversations about a related topic. For more than a decade, Gmail has automatically sorted your emails in different categories, using labels such as Primary, Social, Promotions, etc. The method has been effective, but given the bloated influx of emails, both spammy and useful, Google has determined it needs to step up. This is why it is piloting a new mechanism that not only sorts and prioritizes your important emails but also provides a summary of whatâ€™s important, so you stay on top. And as youâ€™d expect, it is powered by Gemini . Google is calling this new Gmail experience â€œAI Inbox,â€ perhaps because it is built on the same productivity-focused ethos as the now-entombed Google Inbox . It says AI Inbox is identical to being briefed by a personal assistant for your most important commitments and gettinâ€¦

title: 10 of the coolest tech products we saw at CES 2026
summary: Phones, robot vacuum cleaners, AI-powered headphones, and more.
body: Weâ€™ve kicked off the year with a visit to CES 2026 , where companies from all over the world gathered to showcase their latest tech products. From new phones and TVs to robots and handheld gaming consoles, thereâ€™s a lot to see. However, some of these products grabbed more attention than others. Here are the 10 coolest ones we saw at the show in Las Vegas.

title: Samsungâ€™s Ballie robot rolls to a halt
summary: Samsung has shelved its Ballie robot indefinitely and turned it into an internal research project instead.
body: Credit: Samsung TL;DR Samsung has shelved Ballie, killing plans for a consumer launch that was once teased for summer 2025. Ballie has shifted from a planned retail product to an internal â€œactive innovation platform,â€ meaning itâ€™s now for Samsungâ€™s labs. Samsungâ€™s cute, rolling robot assistant, once promised for homes by summer 2025 , has now been shelved. This shift marks a sudden turn from the optimism Samsung showed when Ballie was first introduced in 2020. The small, round robot was meant to be a mobile smart home assistant that could follow you, control devices, and project images onto walls. Now, Samsung is effectively putting an end to hopes for a commercial launch.

title: I spent 20 minutes with Razerâ€™s AI anime girlfriend, and now I need a shower
summary: This is Razer Project Ava, and it sure is ... something.
body: Itâ€™s not a proper CES if I havenâ€™t seen at least one gadget thatâ€™s left me scratching my head and reconsidering my life choices. For CES 2026, I experienced that during my demo session of Razerâ€™s Project Ava. Project Ava was first teased at last yearâ€™s CES, and at the time, it was being marketed as a semi-serious AI gaming assistant. The idea was that Ava would monitor your gaming performance to provide real-time feedback and coaching, helping you improve across virtually any title.

title: How Android 16 quietly became Googleâ€™s best update in years
summary: It started as the most boring update, but Android 16 has grown into a very impressive, feature-filled version.
body: When Android 16 landed on Pixels early last summer, it didnâ€™t make much of a splash. To say that many of us were disappointed by what we saw â€” or what we didnâ€™t see, to be fair â€” would be an understatement. Android 16 felt like Android 15.1, a minor upgrade with some interesting new features, but nothing more. A lot of what was promised with Android 16 didnâ€™t come with that first release. Instead, it took a few months and a couple of quarterly updates, but itâ€™s obvious to me now that Android 16 is the best Android version weâ€™ve had in many years.

title: CES 2026: Segway Navimowâ€™s latest robotic lawn mowers are â€œdrop and mowâ€ ready
summary: Segway Navimow unveiled its latest robot lawn mowers, featuring significant performance and feature upgrades.
body: Credit: Navimow Beautiful, picture-perfect lawns and backyards look fantastic, but anyone who has had to drag around a heavy lawn mower knows how difficult and time-consuming they are to maintain. And even if you went the robot lawn mower route before, installing base stations and perimeter wires is another complicated and tedious chore. Segway Navimow addresses both of these concerns and more with their latest robot lawn mowers. Navimow showed off five new lineups at CES 2026 â€“ four ideal for residential use, while a new series marks the brandâ€™s first foray into commercial lawn mowing. The i2, H2, X4, and Terranox series address very different yard types, from simple suburban lawns to complex, obstacle-dense landscapes and extreme terrain. And most importantly, they make lawn maintenance a breeze.

title: I turned my Pixel 10 Pro into a 2026 BlackBerry and LG Wing â€” seriously
summary: Keyboard cases aren't my thing, but the Clicks Power Keyboard has my attention.
body: For the last couple of years, Clicks has been one of the more interesting brands in the mobile accessory space. After creating keyboard cases for various iPhone and Android phone models, the company came to CES 2026 to showcase something a little different: a keyboard you can attach to any smartphone, without the commitment of a full-on case. Itâ€™s called the Clicks Power Keyboard, and it snaps onto the back of your phone via MagSafe/Qi2 magnets â€” instantly turning your phone into a modern-day BlackBerry. Compared to Clicksâ€™ keyboard cases , the Power Keyboard has a couple of key benefits: 1) You can attach and remove the Clicks Power Keyboard much more easily than a case, and 2) it allows the keyboard to be attach to any phone that has magnets, whether built into it or via a compatible case.

title: RayNeo Air 4 Pro brings worldâ€™s first HDR10 AR display to your face
summary: These 76g glasses feature Bang & Olufsen audio and a custom Vision 4000 chip for an immersive 201-inch cinema experience.
body: RayNeo Air 4 Pro: Worldâ€™s First HDR10-enabled AR Glasses TL;DR RayNeo has launched the Air 4 Pro globally at CES 2026, featuring the worldâ€™s first HDR10 AR displays and Bang & Olufsen-tuned audio. The Air 4 Pro uses FHD micro-OLED displays to create a virtual 201-inch screen experience. These lightweight glasses are expected to go on sale on January 25 for $299. RayNeo has been making AR glasses for a while now, and the company just launched the RayNeo Air 4 Pro at CES 2026 . This marks the global debut of their latest AR glasses, which were launched in China last year. With the Air 4 Pro, RayNeo aims to deliver a cinema-like experience in a lightweight wearable form factor. It claims that these are the worldâ€™s first HDR10 AR displays, offering brighter highlights, deeper shadows, and enhanced color and contrast within the AR experience. A Pixelworks-customized Vision 4000 chip offers real-time video enhancements, such as upscaling SDR content to HDR and converting 2D videos into 3D.

title: Bad with directions? Hereâ€™s how Google Maps on Android XR could help you never get lost again
summary: Or help you course-correct when you end up getting lost anyway.
body: TL;DR Google might have begun working on navigation support for Android XR using Google Maps. Previously, Google has previewed how Maps and Gemini could work together to help you navigate, especially while walking. In addition to step-by-step navigation, your Android XR glasses could use feed from their cameras to help you when youâ€™re feeling lost. Google will also give users the option to turn off navigation or alerts if they donâ€™t want to use it. Android XR is Googleâ€™s next big ambitious project that it envisages to power dozens of different styles of AR glasses and XR headsets over the next few years. Since the platform is closely related to the mobile version of Android, weâ€™d also see a significant chunk of apps cross-functioning across both platforms. Maps is one of them, and Google has already demonstrated how you can use the app to find places of interest or for an immersive aerial or street view. Now, weâ€™re seeing hints about how Android XR could enhance navigation in Google Maps, especially when youâ€™re walking down the street. title: Samsung concludes Galaxy Ring investigation after swelling sent user to hospital
summary: Samsung says cracked molding, not battery, was to blame for the incident.
body: Credit: X/@ZONEofTECH TL;DR Samsung has completed its investigation into an incident that sent tech creator Daniel (@ZONEofTECH) to the hospital last year. The company states that the swelling in Danielâ€™s Galaxy Ring was caused by a crack in its internal molding, not the battery. Samsung and an independent agency both reached the same conclusion. Samsung has officially concluded its investigation into a Galaxy Ring incident that sent a tech creator to the hospital in October last year. The company has reportedly determined that the issue was caused by a crack in the Galaxy Ringâ€™s internal molding, confirming that the device doesnâ€™t pose any wider battery safety risks.

title: Your Android-powered car will get faster updates thanks to Qualcomm
summary: Does your car have Android Automotive? There might be good news for you.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Qualcomm has announced a partnership with Google for a â€œunified reference platformâ€ for Android Automotive OS, starting with Android 17. This means cars with Android Automotive and Snapdragon chips should get quicker access to new Google features. The chipmaker also announced that Project Treble is coming to cars with Snapdragon chips, speeding up system updates. Cars with Android Automotive OS offer a standalone Android experience without having to pair with an Android device. Now, Google and Qualcomm have announced some welcome developments in this space. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here!
summary: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here, and there are a couple of changes worth knowing.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has released the January 2026 Android Canary build. Weâ€™ve found evidence that this software could bring Quick Share/AirDrop integration to Pixel 9 phones. We also spotted a few other visual changes compared to previous releases. Google regularly offers Android Canary builds, allowing users to try new features and changes before theyâ€™re broadly released. Google launched the December 2025 Android Canary build a month ago, and itâ€™s wasting no time in launching its first build of 2026. The company just released the January 2026 Android Canary build, dubbed Android Canary 2601. This build has the version number ZP11.251212.007.

title: Jealous of Pixel 10â€™s AirDrop trick? Pixel 9 is getting it too with latest Android Canary build
summary: The Pixel 9 series is next in line to support AirDrop-style sharing between Android and iPhone.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has added AirDrop-related Quick Share system files to the Pixel 9 series firmware with the latest Android Canary build. Pixel 9a and Pixel 8 series devices donâ€™t yet have these files, suggesting support isnâ€™t reaching older Pixels yet. When Google announced Quick Share interoperability with Appleâ€™s AirDrop late last year, the feature was introduced as a Pixel 10 exclusive. But new evidence suggests that exclusivity may not last very long. Weâ€™ve found signs that AirDrop-style sharing between Android and iPhone is now being prepared for older Pixel phones, starting with the Pixel 9 series.

title: 'Whoever signed off England's tour has to go' - Agnew column
summary: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

title: Google is quietly making the Pixel Launcher faster with a new shortcut
summary: You can now open apps more quickly with a shortcut instead of tapping the app icon.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is pushing out a Pixel Launcher change that lets you open apps by pressing Enter after partially typing their name. The keyboard button switches from Google Search to an arrow/Enter shortcut when an app name is detected. After a limited test, the feature now appears to be rolling out to more Pixel users via a server-side rollout. Google appears to be rolling out a small but meaningful upgrade to the Pixel Launcher that makes opening apps faster than before. After previously testing the feature with a limited group of users, reports now suggest the change is reaching a wider audience.

title: Samsung is borrowing a neat Pixel lock screen trick for One UI 8.5
summary: Galaxy users can now add AI-generated weather effects to their lock screen wallpaper.
body: TL;DR One UI 8.5 includes new, Pixel-like weather effects for the lock screen. Youâ€™ll be able to add AI-generated weather effects to your lock screen wallpaper based on local weather conditions. Effects like rain or snowfall realistically move behind visible objects or people, rather than simply sitting on top of the wallpaper image. Smartphone brands have been paying extra attention to the lock screen lately, treating it as more than just a place to check notifications or check the time. From richer widgets to personalized wallpapers, the smartphone lock screen is becoming more personal, useful, and visually engaging. Samsungâ€™s upcoming One UI 8.5 update looks set to continue that trend with a new weather-driven feature that adds a bit of magic to your wallpaper, and closely mirrors a similar idea Google already offers on Pixel phones. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: CES 2026: Narwalâ€™s latest flagship vacuum robot headlines its next-generation smart cleaning product lineup
summary: At CES 2026, Narwal showcases it's latest flagship robot vacuum, new cordless handheld vacuums, and a mattress vacuum.
body: Narwal is a staple at tech shows like CES and IFA, and the popular smart home cleaning brand is kicking off 2026 with its latest flagship robot vacuum, the Narwal Flow 2 . Featuring a new design, significantly upgraded AI-powered features, an improved mopping system, and more power than ever before, the Narwal Flow 2 sets the standard in automated home cleaning. And thatâ€™s not all! Along with the flagship robot, Narwal is expanding into other categories, including cordless and mattress vacuums. Hereâ€™s everything you need to know. Narwal Flow 2: The 2026 flagship robot vacuum with the most powerful AI system

title: ChatGPT Health will help you get prepared for that doctorâ€™s appointment
summary: ChatGPT's new health feature will help you analyze your wellness data.
body: Credit: OpenAI TL;DR OpenAI is making a push into health by introducing a new feature to its AI chatbot, called ChatGPT Health. This feature will allow users to analyze medical results, prepare for doctor appointments, and get diet and workout advice. ChatGPT Health can connect with electronic medical records and wellness apps. People use ChatGPT for a variety of purposes that can range anywhere from learning how to cook a new recipe to writing code. One of the more popular use cases for the chatbot is answering questions about health and wellness. Now OpenAI is making a greater push into the health space with the rollout of a new ChatGPT feature. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Survey shows most of you donâ€™t like Remix in Google Messages
summary: About half of survey respondents wish they could disable the feature altogether.
body: Google Messages rolled out a Nano Banana-powered Remix feature late last year, letting users make AI edits to images sent and received right inside app. The implementation was heavy-handed, with a prominent Remix button displayed whenever you view an image in Messages full-size. Last month, we asked how you all felt about it â€” and overwhelmingly, you told us youâ€™re not into it. In a poll conducted by Android Authority , more than 1,000 readers have cast votes voicing their opinions on the Remix feature. A whopping 47% of respondents said they donâ€™t like Remix, and that they wished the feature could be disabled.

title: Facer introduces Face Chime and other new features, expansion to RTOS watches
summary: Face Chime, new integrations, and new platforms â€” a big year for Facer.
body: TL;DR Smartwatch face platform Facer made a few announcements at CES today. Facer will soon be available on some RTOS-based wearables. A new Face Chime feature allows watch face makers to add custom hourly chimes to their faces. Smartwatch face platform Facer announced a handful of notable updates at CES today. The popular custom watch face creator and marketplace is expanding to more smartwatch platforms, and Facer faces are getting new capabilities, including a handy hourly chime option. Facer is expanding to RTOS watches soon. Facer will be pre-installed on Reebokâ€™s upcoming Kinetic smartwatch (seen in images here), which will run on VitalOS with MicroEJ VEE Wear. The companyâ€™s also partnering with free and open-source graphics library LVGL, an integration thatâ€™ll see Facer watch faces available on RTOS-based watches from a number of brands, including Xiaomi.

title: CES 2026 just saw a game-changing 3D printer with multi-material and color abilities
summary: This 3D printer can handle multiple colors and materials, is whisper quiet, and is wildly efficient.
body: Credit: AtomForm TL;DR AtomForm has unveiled its latest 3D printer, the Palette 300. This 3D printer features 12 nozzles, allowing it to combine up to 36 colors and 12 materials in a single print. It also cuts waste by up to 90%, helping to reduce swap times. The Palette 300 will become available in early Q2 2026, with pre-orders starting in early Q1 2026. As expected, CES 2026 has been full of unique and interesting product announcements, ranging from a fuzzy emotional support buddy to the worldâ€™s first wireless 7.1.4 Dolby Atmos system . One announcement that shouldnâ€™t be overlooked involves a 3D printer that offers something you wonâ€™t find on other 3D printers. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Mammotionâ€™s new lineup wants to save you from having to rescue your outdoor robots
summary: Mammotion brings real autonomy to your yard with LUBA 3 and SPINO S1 Pro.
body: Credit: Mammotion TL;DR Mammotion showed off two flagship robots at CES 2026 that aim to remove manual lawn mowing and pool cleaning almost entirely. The LUBA 3 mower combines all-wheel drive with upgraded Tri-Fusion Navigation, including 360Â° LiDAR, dual-camera AI vision, and NetRTK for Â±1 cm accuracy. The SPINO S1 Pro pool cleaner features AutoShoreCharge, a robotic arm system that automatically lifts the unit out of the water and docks it for charging. Outdoor maintenance can be tough. Wrestling with a mower on a steep hill or pulling a heavy pool cleaner from the water makes the dream of a perfect yard feel like hard work. Mammotion wants to change that, and its CES 2026 showcase shows itâ€™s almost there. The company is doubling down on its â€œtrue hands-freeâ€ philosophy, introducing two new flagship robots: the LUBA 3 lawn mower and the SPINO S1 Pro pool cleaner.

title: US judge vacates restraining order over Samsung â€˜spying onâ€™ smart TV users (Update)
summary: A hearing is scheduled for January 9.
body: TL;DR Samsung is one of five TV manufacturers accused of illegally collecting automated content recognition (ACR) data from TVs in the state of Texas. A temporary restraining order barred Samsung from collecting ACR data within the state, but the order has been vacated. A hearing to potentially impose a temporary injunction against Samsung is scheduled for January 9. Update, January 8, 2026 (10:57 AM ET): A Samsung representative has reached out to let us know that the temporary restraining order granted on Monday, January 5 was vacated on Tuesday, January 6. That means the order was not in effect when this article was initially published. We regret the error. A hearing is still scheduled for January 9. The original article appears below, unedited.

title: Tired of losing earbuds? OnePlus could introduce a new feature to help
summary: OnePlus may have come up with a cure for your fear of losing an earbud.
body: Credit: Lil Katz / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus and OPPO could introduce a new feature to their earbuds that automatically detects when an earbud drops out of your ear. If you lose an earbud, your earbuds will play a sound and an alert will be sent to your phone that will help you find the fallen earbud. You may not receive an alert if the â€œNotificationsâ€ permission is turned off or the app is terminated. Have you ever lost an earbud because it unexpectedly fell out of your ear? OnePlus and OPPO appear to be working on a new feature that could help save you from suffering such a fate again. title: T-Mobile just announced its first fee increase of the year: Hereâ€™s what is changing
summary: It might not be a massive increase, but it's the second of its kind in less than a full year's time.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is raising its Regulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Fee by $0.50 per line starting January 21. Combined with the $.50 hike in April of 2025, fees are up about $1 in less than a year. The vague fee structure continues to draw criticism, though grandfathered plans with taxes and fees included are unaffected. Earlier today, T-Mobile unveiled its new Better Value Plan, promising a better experience for new and existing customers who switch to it. Like every plan offered by T-Mobile these days, this one doesnâ€™t include taxes and fees. Thatâ€™s become important for T-Mobile, as separate charges mean it is much easier to increase customer spending without officially raising prices by simply increasing said fees. Weâ€™ve already seen the company increase its telco fees as recently as last April, but it looks like the company is doing it again. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google Messagesâ€™ new one-handed-friendly menu begins rollout
summary: Itâ€™s a small change, but it should makes everyday actions less awkward on big phones.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google Messagesâ€™ new context menu, which we first spotted being tested in October, is now rolling out widely in beta. The menu moves key actions below the selected message, making one-handed use easier on larger phones. Early feedback appears to be largely positive. Back in October, we spotted Google testing a redesigned context menu in Messages. We didnâ€™t know when or even if it would roll out, though it seemed like a sure thing given its utility for one-handed phone use â€” especially on some of the large-screen flagships on the market. It took a while, but now it appears that the change is starting to roll out more widely. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: T-Mobileâ€™s new Better Value Plan promises value its rivals canâ€™t beat, but will it deliver?
summary: While it's still far from cheap, this truly is a better value than Essentials and even Experience More.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is introducing a new Better Value Plan, which requires at least three lines and starts at $140 a month. The new plan also requires at least two lines to be ported in for new customers, or for customers to have been with T-Mobile for five years. The Better Value Plan has impressive perks that actually compare favorably with Experience More, for around the same price. While T-Mobile is still arguably the best value in the postpaid wireless market , the gap between it and its rivals has narrowed over the last few years as the Un-Carrier has increasingly mirrored competitors on pricing and overall value. Likely in an effort to push back against that perception, T-Mobile has announced a new value-focused plan it claims AT&T and Verizon canâ€™t compete with. title: Spotify adds real-time listening activity to Messages, with group chats coming soon
summary: There's also a new Request to Jam feature, making it easier to start shared listening sessions with friends.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Spotify Messages now offers an opt-in Listening activity feature, allowing connected friends and family to see what you are playing in real-time. A new Request to Jam button has been added to chats, making it easier to coordinate and start remote shared listening sessions. The features are rolling out to iOS and Android users in markets where Messages is enabled. Group chat support is planned for the near future. Spotify rolled out a Messages feature in August last year, and today, the company is expanding its functionality with Listening Activity and Request to Jam. Listening activity is an opt-in feature that allows Spotify users to display the music theyâ€™re currently listening to within Spotify Messages in real-time. If youâ€™re not actively listening, your most recently played song will be displayed instead.

title: Beatbotâ€™s AquaSense X shows how far robotic pool care has come at CES 2026
summary: The latest robotic pool-cleaning robots from Beatbot take automation to the next level.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority CES has a habit of shining a spotlight on subtly game-changing tech categories. Every year, alongside the headline-grabbing TVs, laptops, and smart home gadgets, there are products that donâ€™t always get the same attention but still shape everyday life. Pool care is one of them. For years, robotic pool cleaners have promised convenience, but many still require a fair amount of hands-on effort once the cleaning is done. At CES 2026, Beatbot is using that gap as an opportunity to rethink what modern pool care can look like. One of the global leaders in robotic pool cleaning is unveiling two new products at the show: the flagship Beatbot AquaSense X, designed to push pool automation further than before, and the Beatbot Sora 70 , a model focused on dependable, everyday cleaning. Together, they show two distinct approaches to the same problem, with AquaSense X very clearly leading the charge.

title: You can finally grab Ouraâ€™s long-teased charging case
summary: The Oura Ring experience just got more convenient.
body: TL;DR Ouraâ€™s portable charging case is now available after being unveiled back in October. With a built-in battery, the clamshell case holds up to five full charges. It is priced at $99 and can be found on sale at Oura.com and select third-party retailers. Ouraâ€™s long-awaited portable charging case is now officially available for purchase. We first covered the accessory back in October when it was announced alongside the Oura Ring 4 Ceramic collection, and while weâ€™d hoped to see it hit shelves by the end of 2025, an early January arrival is close enough. Portable charging cases arenâ€™t a novel idea (brands like RingConn and Samsung already offer their own), but this launch closes a noticeable gap in Ouraâ€™s accessory lineup.

title: Google could soon bring the new Fitbit app experience to free users
summary: The Public Preview program could expand to non-subscribers, though the AI coach could remain a Premium exclusive.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Google has been spotted preparing to bring the redesigned Fitbit app experience to free-tier users via the Public Preview program. The redesign includes updated Today, Fitness, Sleep, and Health tabs. Free users could soon be able to opt in and switch between the standard and redesigned versions of the app. However, the AI-powered â€œAsk Coachâ€ feature could remain exclusive to Premium subscribers. With the launch of the Pixel Watch 4 in August 2025, Google announced that the Fitbit app is getting a redesign and a new AI-powered personal health coach feature . The redesigned Fitbit experience began rolling out to users in late October, but it was available only for Fitbit Premium subscribers and through the Public Preview program. It appears that Google is preparing to roll out the redesigned Fitbit experience to free users as well, by including them in the Public Preview program for this feature. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find â€¦

title: Apple might copy this key Galaxy S23 Ultra featureâ€¦ in 2028
summary: You might have to wait a couple of years to see this nifty Android camera hardware on iPhones.
body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR Morgan Stanley has reported that Apple will only adopt 200MP cameras on the iPhone 21 series in 2028. By contrast, Android phones first adopted 200MP sensors in 2022, and a growing number of OEMs use them for their main or tele cameras. If confirmed, this means Android manufacturers will enjoy a major hardware advantage for several more years. Android phones have long offered 200MP cameras, with Motorola, Xiaomi, and Samsung initially leading the charge. Weâ€™ve since seen 200MP sensors used on Android phones by OPPO, realme, HONOR, and vivo. What about Apple, though? Well, it sounds like weâ€™re in for a long wait. According to an investor note by Morgan Stanley (spotted via AppleInsider ), Apple will only adopt 200MP cameras on the iPhone 21 series in 2028. Of course, Apple is tipped to skip the iPhone 19 name in 2027 in favor of iPhone 20.

title: Philips will take the hard work out of complex Hue Lights scenes with new update
summary: By being spatially aware of the exact positioning of each compatible smart light.
body: Credit: Jonathan Feist / Android Authority TL;DR An upcoming Philips Hue update will soon let you scan various compatible smart lights spread across a room. You will then be able to create nature-inspired scenes that automatically manage colors and brightness for all lights. In addition, Philips Hue video doorbell and Secure camera will soon also support Apple Home. If you have multiple smart lights and mingle with their different color settings for the perfect mood lighting, Philips Hue has an update that will excite you. Signify, the company behind Philips lighting, has announced a new feature, called â€œSpatialAware,â€ at CES 2026 that will let you set different scenes by using multiple Philips Hue-compatible light sources together. You can use your phoneâ€™s camera to scan the various Philips Hue smart lights spread across any room. The app will create a spatial map of the different placements and automatically design lighting scenarios. In its announcement , Signify says that the feature aims to recreate lighting scenarios inspired by nature. It will automatically manage the colors and intensity of the light to create a harmonious blend.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.
